title: Vector Addition
text: Calculate the $$x$$ components and $$y$$ components for Vectors A and B and add them up to find the $$x$$ component and $$y$$ component for the final vector. Then to find the total length of the resulting vector, use Pythagorean theorem $$V^2={Vx}^2+{Vy}^2$$

title: Apply Trigonometric Functions and the Pythagorean theorem
text: Solve $$30cos\left(68\right)-27.5cos\left(66\right)$$ where $$27.5cos\left(66\right)$$ is the $$x$$ component for vector A and $$30cos\left(68\right)$$ is the $$x$$ component for vector B. Solve $$30sin\left(68\right)+27.5sin\left(66\right)$$ where $$27.5sin\left(66\right)$$ is the $$y$$ component for vector A and $$30sin\left(68\right)$$ is the $$y$$ component for vector B. Now use Pythagorean theorem for the total length.
